text: Q19.| [MSQ] e 'BASIC DATABASE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM ~ Page6 i. For any data file, it is possible to construct two separate sparse first level indexes on different keys ii. For any data file, it is possible to construct two separate dense first level indexes on different keys. iii. For any data file, it is possible to construct a sparse first (lower) level index and a dense second (higher) level index. Both indices should be useful. iv. For any data file, it is possible to construct a dense first (lower)level index and a sparse second (higher) level index. Both indices should be useful Which of the above statements is/are true? (a) (i) & (i) (b) (i) & (iv) (0) (i) & (iii) & (iv) (d) All are true 1
